formattedAddress: Marquis Theatre, 210 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: Marquis Theatre, 210 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

originalText.text: Amazing show! The special effects are second to none and it has the perfect mix of great humor and genuine heart. I wish I could see it again tomorrow but it was definitely the highlight of my trip to the big apple!

text.text: Amazing show! The special effects are second to none and it has the perfect mix of great humor and genuine heart. I wish I could see it again tomorrow but it was definitely the highlight of my trip to the big apple!

originalText.text: What a fun show! Beetlejuice, the character, totally interacts with the crowd, cracking jokes about the guy in the front row and about the audience in general. It's a really funny show too. Lots of singing and dancing. If you love the movie then you'll love the musical! Be aware, there is some swearing and adult humour in the show. Our 10 year old twins have heard the swear words before and the adult humour went over their heads so not really a concern. The TKTS staff were great when buying tickets because they warned us of that. Small theatre so there really isn't a bad seat in the house. Highly recommend if you want a fun night out!

originalText.text: That was so much fun! It’s a pity this show has been somehow struggling and will close soon, because it’s totally hilarious. Great homage to the classic movie, but also lots of new storytelling elements and character development that push the comedy further (like Delia and Otho). Also appreciated the extra stage-time of Beetlejuice.

originalText.text:
Wow!Jolene and I have seen many shows on Broadway but BEETLEJUICE is definitely one of the top shows on the list! The energy, passion and excitement of these performers is contagious and you can’t help but get into the songs.

They get the audience involved and have a contest for the best dressed. Lidia will literally call that person out at the end and give a gift. so bring you best gothic outfit or black and white stripe get up!

Lidia and BEETLEJUICE get way more screen time here than in the movie and the storie is a little different but focuses less on the couple who die during the movie and more on the two stars BJ and Lidia.

The Marque is massive! It will take you a while to get to the bathroom and around here and the elevators are wild like giant quick elevator tubes in the center. The BEETLEJUICE fan art outside is so cool and drinks are slamming!

originalText.text: Beetlejuice the Broadway NYC musical at the Marquis Theater June 2022. This musical is for adults even though I seen a good amount of kids. It's adult humor and can be too much for the young ones. I sat Orchestra left row G seat 5 View was great. Strong cast show has similarities to the original movie but in a musical form. Great variety of  scene's and costume changing throughout show. Entrance is between W 46 Street and W 45th Street as shown in pictures. Take escalator one flight up and you will find theater. There are elevators as well. Handicap accessible in theater. As of now due to COVID mask are in effect.
